title: Desire to See Jesus
verses: From every earthly pleasure, From every transient joy,
From eve-ry mor-tal trea-sure, That soon will fade and die;
No lon-ger these de-sir-ing, Upwards our wish-es tend,
To no-bler bliss as-pir-ing, And joys that nev-er end.

From every piercing sorrow,
That leaves our breast to-day
Or threatens us to-morrow,
Hope turns our eyes away,
On wings of faith ascending,
We see the land of light,
And feel our sorrows ending,
In infinite delight.

metadata.musical_notation: Present with treble and bass clef
metadata.theological_significance: Expresses the believer's desire to leave earthly pleasures for heavenly joy
